page.title: 04COLLEGE OF TECHNOLOGY
page.content: Bromley College of Technology was visited by Raglan Junior School. The principal answered our questions. The college is built on the site of an old house whcih was burnt down during the war. The house was owned by Montague Norman, Governor of the Bank of England. They teach all kinds of subects at the college such as motor engineering, computer studies, metalwork and home electrics. We liked the computer room best and in one room there was a gigantic computer bigger than a freezer but in the next room there was a smaller computer that could do even more. It could print 600 letters in just one second. Most of the people that go to the college live quite close to it. No-one lives in the college.
